newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ dollar closes soft after narrow trading.
newsitem.headline: NZ dollar closes soft after narrow trading.

text.p: The New Zealand dollar closed well-offered on Thursday ahead of a long holiday weekend.
The kiwi finished at 5.00 p.m. (0500 GMT) at US$0.6914/21 against its 0.6920/27 opening.
Dealers said a local bank sold into the market in the morning at around 0.6920 and it never reccovered.
"The market feels a little heavy," said a Wellington bank dealer.
Also weighing the kiwi down was the Australian dollar which eased back and was seen falling further.
The Trade-Weighted Index closed at 68.84 slightly up from its 68.78 opening.
Merchandise trade data showing a $2 million deficit in March against expectations of a $170 million surplus.
However, despite recent concerns about the growing size of curent account deficit, foreign exchange traders said little note was taken of the number.
